summary: the characterization of cellular proteins required for virus infection is essential for understanding viral life cycles. the characterization of cellular proteins required for virus infection is essential for understanding viral life cycles and may provide cellular targets for antiviral therapies. the aminopeptidase N (APN) glycoproteins are receptors for human coronavirus 229E (HCoV-229E), the transmissible gastroenteritis virus of swine, and the feline coronavirus of genetic group 1[7-10]. the molecular mechanisms and specific proteins involved in adhesion of PHE-CoV to host cells have not been elucidated. the cell lines were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC), N2a (ATCC CCL-131) and 293T (ATCC CRL-11268) cells were maintained at 37°C in 5% CO2. recombinant S protein of PHE-CoV was subcloned by PCR. cDNA library from N2a cells was panned with the recombinant S protein. mRNA was purified using the poly (A) Quick mRNA Isolation Kit. cDNA library was constructed with 10 g mRNA. the bound phages were eluted with 200 l of T7 elution buffer (TBS) and amplified by infecting Escherichia coli BLT5403[15]. each PCR consisted of 30 cycles of denaturation at 94°C for 1 min, annealing at 50°C for 1 min, and extension at 72°C for 7 min. 293T cells were transfected with the pcDNA3.1 (+) expression plasmid containing the chimeric gene. after 24 h, the cells were replated in selective media containing 50-100 g/ml ampicillin[18], and single ampicillin-resistant clones were selected. cells were lysed in 500 l of radioimmune precipitation buffer. blots were blocked at room temperature for 3 h with 3% BSA in PBS containing Tween 20 (0.05%) and then incubated overnight with a 1:2,000 dilution of the rabbit anti-S protein antibody. cells were incubated with 100 l of soluble anti-NCAM antibody (10-25 g/ml) for 1 h at 37°C. double-stranded siRNAs were designed using (NN) N19 nt (where N is any nucleotide) and a GC content of less than 50%. RNAs were deprotected and annealed using the Silencer siRNA Construction Kit. 67N strain of PHE-CoV was propagated and assayed by the plaque method in N2a cell culture. cell lines were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC), N2a (ATCC CCL-131) and 293T. production of his6-tagged fusion S protein was induced with 1% methanol. after 5 d, the protein was collected from the supernatant. cDNA library was constructed with 10 g mRNA. the 96-well plates were coated with 200 l of the purified S protein. nonspecific sites were blocked with 5% bovine serum albumin for 1 h at 37°C. a 100 l aliquot of the T7 phage display library was added to the wells. 293T cells were transfected with the pcDNA3.1 (+) expression plasmid containing the chimeric gene. after 24 h, the cells were replated in selective media containing 50-100 g/ml ampicillin[18], and single ampicillin-resistant clones were selected. sate was incubated with 3 ml of glutathione-Sepharose beads conjugated with His6-tagged fusion S (6 mg) cell lysates were electrophoresed through 12% sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gels and transferred to polyvinylidene difluoride membranes. blots were blocked at room temperature for 3 h with 3% BSA in PBS containing Tween 20 (0.05 fluorescein-conjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG (H+L) was added to the N2a cell mixtures for 30 min. after 48 hours, the samples were analyzed on a BD FACSAria flow cytometer. cDNA library from N2a cells on T7 phage was enumerated using the plaque assay method on LB semi-solid medium. amplification of inserts in randomly selected clones revealed that the library contained >90% recombinants with an average insert size of >300 bp. by the end of the fifth round of panning, there was a 320-fold increase in specific clones compared to the number of clones obtained after the first round. however, there was no further enrichment after additional rounds of panning. 22% of the phage clones had an insert size of 400 bp. 15% of the clones had an insert size of 400 bp. BLAST analysis identification of fifth round-insert sequences. the polypeptides migrated to a molecular weight corresponding to NCAM (140 kDa), Sf3b2 (100 kDa), Hdac2 (55 kDa) and RPS13 (17 kDa), respectively. the antibodies were detected by horseradish peroxidaseconjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG antibodies. the antibodies were detected by horseradish peroxidaseconjugated goat anti-mouse IgG antibodies. the 293T cells transfected with vector alone were immunoprecipitated with anti-S protein antibody. the cells were lysed in 500 l of radioimmune precipitation buffer. they were incubated with 300 l of glutathione-Sepharose beads. the supernatant was electrophoresed through 12% sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gels. anti-NCAM antibody inhibition of PHE-CoV binding to N2a cells. anti-NCAM antibody inhibited PHE-CoV binding to N2a cells by 75%. siRNA strand Sequence SiNCAM79 Antisense 5'-AAGGTCTTTGCAAAGCCCAAACCCCTGTCTC-3' Sense 5'-AATTTGCTATGTGGTAGCTGTCTC-3' Sense 5'-AATTTCAGCTACCACATAGACCCTGTC-3' siCtrl Antisense 5'-AATTTGTGTGAACCTCTC-3' Sense 5'-AATTTCAGCTACCACATAGACCCTGTC-3 FITC-conjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG (1:50 dilution) was added to the N2a cell mixtures for 30 min at room temperature. cells were washed and observed with an Olympus FV1000 laser scanning confocal microscope. the size of the phage display library exceeded the estimated number. most of the expressed genes were represented in this library. electrophoresis results show 28 S and 18 S bands were clear. Approximately 100 clones were randomly picked from individual plaques. DNA sequences of clones were amplified by PCR and analyzed on an agarose gel to determine the insert size. cDNA was used to construct the transfect plasmid. the correct expression of NCAM, Sf3b2, Hdac2 and RPS13 in 293T cells was studied. cell lysates from 293T cells were run on a 10% SDS-PAGE gel. blots were probed with a 1:10 dilution of the rabbit anti-NCAM polyclonal IgG (200 g/ml) the antibodies were detected by horseradish peroxidaseconjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG antibodies. supernatants of 293T cells transfected with plasmid encoding the screened gene were immunoprecipitated with anti-S protein antibody. the 293T cells transfected with vector alone were controls. soluble form of NCAM was incubated with S protein, a 160 kDa band was observed. the proteins were analyzed by western blotting. Lane 4-6, Sf3b2, Hdac2 and RPS13 were not immunoprecipitated with S protein. a soluble form of the anti-NCAM antibody blocked the association of PHE-CoV with N2a cells. the NCAM siRNAs inhibited PHE-CoV infection for prolonged periods of time. the effect of NCAM gene silencing in N2a cells was confirmed by flow cytometry. the effect was completely suppressed within 72 h. double-stranded siRNA could effectively inhibit NCAM expression in N2a cells. the cells were harvested after siRNA transfection and analyzed by FACS with rabbit anti-NCAM antibody. culture supernantants were collected 120 hours after the PHE-CoV challenge. Knock-down of NCAM caused a marked reduction of PHE-CoV infection within 84 hours. affected piglets show symptoms such as generalized muscle trembling, abnormal walking, lack of co-ordination, convulsions and lying on the side and paddling legs. only NCAM of the CAMs appears on the surface of muscle cells in parallel with the ability of the muscle cell surface to accept synapses. tinating encephalomyelitis virus (PHE-CoV) suggests that these three viruses with different host specificities diverged fairly recently[1]. polysialic acid (PSA) is a developmentally regulated carbohydrate composed of a linear homopolymer of a-2,8-linked sialic acid residues. the entry of coronaviruses is a multi-step process that involves: docking on the plasma membrane, binding to a receptor or hemagglutinin-esterase (HE) protein of PHE-CoV binds to polysialic acid (PSA) moieties. spike (S) protein of PHE-CoV binds to NCAM at the plasma. porcine hemagglutinating encephalomyelitis is an infectious disease. etiology exists [39] after a virus binds to a cellular constituent acting as a receptor, the receptor might be altered. the authors declare that they have no competing interests.
